column17: Property destruction: Two children escaped unhurt when the house they were sleeping in was torched in a suspected politically motivated attack at Musanhi Village. The house was owned by a local MDC chairperson and attacked by suspected Zanu-PF youths.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A teenage girl was abducted and raped by a gang of five ZANU PF supporters. The attackers also burned down the tuck shop she was working in, because it was owned by an MDC-T official. It is not clear if the victim survived the attack.

On 19 September 2013, police forces dispersed a group of WOZA protesters with batons in Bulawayo (Bulawayo, Bulawayo). The protesters were gathered at a police station to call for the release of their colleagues. At least two group leaders were arrested. Injuries not reported. [size=no report]

column9: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; Women (Zimbabwe); Journalists (Zimbabwe)
column17: Police forces disperse a group of WOZA protesters with batons. The protesters were calling on increased living standards for the poor. Several arrested, including a journalist. Injuries not reported.

column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Property destruction: ZANU PF sub-offices and a supermarket at Machipisa Shopping Centre in Highfield were gutted by a fire that destroyed property worth millions of dollars. The cause of the fire is not know, though ZANU-PF officials assert the cause is arson. MDC-T officials claim no knowledge of the incident.

Protesting non-payment of salaries, wives of a group of mine workers employed at the Hwange Colliery Company were attacked by police forces. At least two injuries reported. Members of MDC-T later condemned the action, blaming Zanu-PF for the police brutality.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Police, at the suspected direction of Zanu-PF destroyed the burnt the huts of MDC-T adherents in two Mashonaland West towns. No report of causality.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Police, at the suspected direction of Zanu-PF destroyed the burnt the huts of MDC-T adherents in two Mashonaland West towns. No report of causality.
A civilian is arrested, detained and beaten by the police.
Parents with children at Chikumbiro Primary School in Mkoba's high-density suburb, Gweru, demonstrated against the headmaster, accusing her of embezzling school funds.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: An armed gang of over 20 ZANU PF youths is reported to have severely assaulted a member of the MDC-T in Makoni South, leaving him for dead in a hidden bushy area. It is reported the gang attacked the MDC-T member participating in a government grain loan scheme. The exact date of the assault is not known.
Church petitioners block the entrance to their church to protest the removal of their pastor by church elders. The protest lasted an hour.

column7: ZDWU: Zimbabwe Diamond Miners Workers Union
column17: Recently terminated diamond miners gather outside a political meeting and threaten a senior official from the company who was present.

column7: PF-ZCNLWV: Patriotic Forum for Zimbabwe Children of National Liberation War Veterans Association
column17: Children of war vets protest in front of the US Embassy in Harare to call for an end of sanctions against Zimbabwe. The US imposed sanctions against Zimbabwe ten years ago over allegations of human rights abuses and election fraud.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Unconfirmed reports of police assaulting MDC-T activists, including a party executive, in Bulawayo. There are believed to be injuries. The attack occurred on or around 22/11.

column9: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: Police in Bulawayo assaulted scores of members of the Women of Zimbabwe Arise (WOZA). The activists were on their way to Mat North Resident Minister Sithokozile Mathuthus offices to submit a petition on the groups needs and expectations. Casualties/injuries not reported. Exact date of the protest is not known.
Five homesteads have been destroyed in Bikita in a clash over land. Causalities not reported.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Unidentified attackers killed an MDC-T Organising Secretary in Nyamandlovu. Following the attack, the family of the victim openly accused officials of ZANU-PF of carrying out the attack.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Scores of Zanu-PF supporters in Gutu staged a demonstration at Mpandawana Growth Point over alleged irregularities and widespread disenfranchisement during last weekends provincial elections.
Lawyers in Mutare and Harare took to the streets in protest marches against what they saw as a deterioration of the rule of law in Zimbabwe.
Police in Harare arrested 37 Katswe Sistahood protestors demonstrating against gender related violence. The police cited interference with President Robert Mugabes nearby motorcade.
Lawyers in Mutare and Harare took to the streets in protest marches against what they saw as a deterioration of the rule of law in Zimbabwe.
A group of Nyau dancers allegedly assaulted a man
Two vigilantes kill an 81 year old man for suspected witchcraft.
A soldier attacks bank employees and customers after he believed he refused his money while trying to conduct a withdrawal.
Angry depositors ran amok at a downtown bank, breaking down a door and smashing windows after money ran out to pay withdrawals.

column9: GALZ: Gays and Lesbians Association of Zimbabwe; LGBT (Zimbabwe)
column17: Bulawayo police arrest five members of the Gays and Lesbians Association of Zimbabwe (Galz) who were holding an end of year party at a city hotel. Two reported assault and injury.
Journalists employed with the Zimbabwe Broadcasting Cooperation protest outstanding salary payment.
Police quell disturbances caused by customers of a money transferring organization who were unable to access their funds. Some of the rioters clashed briefly with police.

Unidentified arsonists attempt to set the buildings of two state run media outlets, Chronicle and Sunday News, alight during the early morning hours. The attackers reportedly hurled a flammable liquid at a disused wooden door leading to the newspapers advertising department and set it on fire before fleeing into the night. No causalities or injuries reported, though it is not clear if anyone was present at the time of the attack. Exact date of the attack is not clear.
Waste management protesters dump refuse at the main bus terminus in Mbare to protest unpaid allowances.
A group of six police officers accost and forcefully strip naked a known transgender activist. It is not believed the activist was participating in a protest at the time.

Angry villagers allegedly teamed up and violently stopped the Deputy Sheriff and police from demolishing homes at the centre of a tribal feud between two village heads in Bikita. No reports of injury.
Wives of mine employees gather outside managers offices to protest non-payment of their husbands salaries.

A group of Bikita villagers assault their village head and forcibly march him to Bikita rural district council offices over a disagreement of land use. Ten of the suspected perpetrators were later arrested.

Members of the Zimbabwe National Students Union protest at Harare Polytechnic against """"decline in education standards in the country as well as college authorities' reluctance to hold Student Representative Council elections."""" Twelve arrested.
Disgruntled senior Agricultural and Rural Development Authority workers slept at the parastatals head office in Harare to protest against non-payment of salaries.

Riot police were called to restrain parents who were demonstrating against Chiredzi Government Secondary School headmistress for alleged misappropriation of funds. The group was demanding to speak to the headmistress, who locked herself in her office, insisting she was not allowed to speak to the Press. Many of the protesters rushed her office, in an attempt to force themselves in.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front; Aid Workers (Zimbabwe)
column17: Members of ZANU-PF tried to disrupt a World Food Programme food (WFP) distribution function at Ntabazinduna in Matabeleland North. The group accused the American government of imposing sanctions over political repression against Zimbabwe which they said hurt ordinary people.

column7: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: Over 1,000 WOZA members marched through the streets to the Mhlahlandlela Government Complex, as part of the pressure groups annual Valentines Day demos. A statement said WOZA is demanding free primary education for all vulnerable and under privileged children by the end of 2014. Police blocked the demonstrators near the complex.

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC: Movement for Democratic Change (Mangoma Faction)
column17: Elton Mangoma and an ally are assaulted by Tsvangirai youths during ongoing intra-party battles. The two suffered moderate injuries.

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column8: MDC: Movement for Democratic Change (Mangoma Faction)

Gweru City Council workers stage demonstration at the local authority's works yard protesting the hosting of tomorrow's centenary celebrations. The workers demand that the council pay them their salary arrears before spending money on celebrations.

column7: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front; Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: ZANU-PF party youth and members of the Womens League mount a demonstration to block ousted provincial chairman Cde Amos Midzi from addressing a press conference.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association; ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: War Veterans and ZANU-PF youth demonstrate against Mashonaland East provincial chair Ray Kaukonde outside the parties provincial offices. The rioters attempt to storm the building resulting in damage to the offices and clashes with the local police.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A group of Zanu PF youths assault another Zanu PF member accusing him of sowing division within the ruling party.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A former ZANU-PF Harare provincial youth chairman is abducted and severely beaten by men suspected of being ZANU-PF members belonging to a rival faction. State agents are apparently involved in the abduction.
A civilian is beaten and tortured by police, supported by a mob, for unknown reasons.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Rival factions of ZANU-PF supporters, one faction supporting Vice-President Mujuru and the other supporting Justice Minister Mnangagwa, violently clash. The dispute is tied to the appointment of local chairpersons.

column7: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; BPRA: Bulawayo Progressive Residents Association; ZCIEA: Zimbabwe Chamber of Informal Economy Association
column17: Bulawayo residents take to the streets to demonstrate against the introduction of pre-paid water meters in the city.The protests are led by civic groups, including the Bulawayo Progressive Residents Association (BPRA) and Women of Zimbabwe Arise (WOZA).

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A Zanu PF member assaulted another Zanu PF member accusing the victim of belonging to VP Mujuru's faction.

column8: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Fifteen Zanu PF Chipangano militias harassed and assaulted four Harare Municipal Police officers and barred them from clamping motor vehicles at Cart House. The perpetrators declared that the area belonged to them as an empowerment policy by their party.
Residents launch a peaceful protest over water provision. The police arrest the leaders of the protests.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association; ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: War veterans launch a demonstration calling for the immediate resignation of Politburo members accused of plotting to topple Robert Mugabe.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: The Zanu PF Provincial Chairperson was assaulted by some members of the ruling party who accuse him of factionalism.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youths protest against Vice President Mujuru, who was set to fly to Dubai, at Harare Airport.
Members of Masvingo Residents Trust demonstrate against Zimbabwe Supply Authority before being dispersed by police. The demonstrations organisers are arrested.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF supporters protest and block Politburo members from submitting their applications for Central Committee positions. The politicians are accused of supporting Mujuru.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A group of agitated Zanu PF activists belonging to the faction led by Minister Emmerson Mnangagwa marched in protest against Minister Kudakwashe Bhasikiti, Dzikamai Mavhaire and the provincial chairperson retired Brigadier General Killian Gwanetsa allegedly belonging to the VP Mujuru's faction.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZNU-PF youths attack the president and supporters of the fledgling Transform Zimbabwe party.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF supporters demonstrate against labour minister Nicholas Goche and prevent him from attending a provincial coordination committee. Goche is reportedly allied for Mujuru. There are no reports of injuries.
Zanu-PF district chairperson is found dead. The death follows a campaign of death threats and the killing is suspected to be politically motivated. The chairperson was allied with Mujuru.
Riots erupt in Harare over the purge of Mujuru allies from government. There are reports of suspended politicians rioting. There are no reports of engagements with police.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu PF members held a demonstration against the Wedza Senator Eunice Goto and Wedza North MP Simon Musanhi and other people suspected to be aligned to Mujuru.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: An MDC-T official is arrested on suspicion of treason and tortured by the Zimbabwe police.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Supporters of rival ZANU-PF politicians clash during an inter-district meeting. The clashes stem from a contraversial vote of no-confidence.
Residents fight running battles with police during demonstrations over power outages. The demonstrations were organised by the Masvingo Residents Trust
Unknown assailants leave poisoned aerosols in the offices of ZANU-PF Justice Minister Emmerson Mnangagwa. Mnangagwas secretary is hospitalised by the substance.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions
column17: Angry farmers protest outside ZANU-PF headquarters against the failure of a company jointly-owned by Zanu-PF youth wing to deliver promised farming inputs.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column17: Youths allied with Tsvangirai assault six members of the National Organising Secretary of the Youth Wing of the MDC Renewal Faction

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column17: Youths allied with Tsvangirai assault the District Organiser for Chitungwiza South who is a member of the Renewal faction of the MDC.

Police attempt to evict 40 teachers accused of failing to settle their rent arrears to Shabanie-Mashava Mines. The evictees forcible recover the proptery removed by the police and engage in a standoff with police. There are however no reports of violence.

column9: GALZ: Gays and Lesbians Association of Zimbabwe
column17: Armed men invade a party organised by GALZ and assault attendees.
30 workers from Mbada Diamonds protest outside the companies Harare headquarters demanding outstanding salaries.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU PF supporters in Chipinge staged a demonstration Saturday against legislator, Joseph Chinotimba, who reportedly wants to take over a farm in the constituency.

Local farmers storm Acting President Emmerson Mnangagwas Sherwood Block Farm in Kwekwe and with a petition demanding the eviction and arrest of his cleric neighbour whom they accused of being violent and grabbing their properties.

An MDC-T supporter is assaulted by village head Aleck Mangisi in Hurungwe West. The victim had grabbed the list of names and had threatened to tear it apart because his name had been deliberately omitted because of his affiliation to the MDC-T party.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column17: Members of the Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) formation led by Morgan Tsvangirai and some belonging to the MDC Renewal Team clash at a funeral. The clash started when a member of the MDC-Renewal faction accused Tsvangirai of working with Mugabe.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association; ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Riot police and soldiers attack a group of Zanu PF youths and war veterans who had invaded Chihoza Farm to stop Edwin Chinotimba, the son of Buhera South legislator Joseph Chinotimba from occupying the farm. The protesters argued the Chinotimba already owned substantial land and was not local to the area and so should not be given priority in land allocation.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youth invade farms belonging to party members supposedly aligned with ousted Vice-President Joice Mjuru. The youth protest that the current owners do not deserve the land due to their political affiliations.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association; ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: More than 100 ZANU-PF and war veterans protestors staged a demonstration calling for the dismissal of senior staff at Mutawatawa District hospital.
Six villagers are hospitalised by police following a land ownership dispute involving Green Fuels Private Limited.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youth invade farms belonging to party members supposedly aligned with ousted Vice-President Joice Mjuru. The youth protest that the current owners do not deserve the land due to their political affiliations.

column7: ZISMIWU: Zimbabwe Sugar Milling Industry Workers Union
column17: About 1 000 cane workers demonstrate in the sugar-growing town of Chiredzi demanding the resignation of the secretary-general of Zimbabwe Sugar Milling Industry Workers Union. The secretary-general is accused of not representing their interests as well as making donations to several organisations without their consent while ignoring the workers welfare.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Police round up ZANU-PF supporters who invaded farms belonging to party members supposedly aligned with ousted Vice-President Joice Mjuru.

200 workers at Caps Holdings storm the companies headquarters in Harare and hold their management hostage demanding payment of their salaries which have reportedly remained unpaid for the past 20 months.
More than 200 villagers stage a demonstration at Masvingo Central Police Station against failure by Chiefs Musara and Chikwanda to resolve a boundary dispute. 8 of the demonstrators are arrested.

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column8: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A small group of MDC and ZANU-PF attack each other during a MDC youth mobilization and recruitment exercise resulting in serious injuries. MDC sources and government-run newspapers differ over who were the attackers and who were the victims.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youth invade four farms they claim belong to supporters of out of favour minister Didymus Mutasa. The youths occupied the farms arguing that the owners did not deserve them as they belonged to Mutasas faction, which lost the recent power struggle. The police removed and arrested the youths.
Buhera South legislator Cde Joseph Chinotimba stages a one-man demonstration against City of Harare for arresting and impounding pirate taxis.

column9: Military Forces of Zimbabwe (1987-2017) Central Intelligence Organization
column17: A bodyguard at Vice President Emmerson Mnangagwa's Midlands farm died after President Robert Mugabe's deputy reportedly accused him of snooping for Joice Mujuru. The suspected murder of the CIO operative occurred after a heated argument with Mnangagwa.
Two police officers accused of corruption are beaten while in custody.
Five people die after their house is petrol bombed. The victims had been accused by a local man of practicising witchcraft.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Hundreds of Zanu-PF supporters demonstrate against their representative in the National Assembly Cde Didymus Mutasa, calling for his expulsion from the party for various indiscretions.
Starafrica Corporations employees stage demonstration at the companies head office amid frustrations over unpaid salaries.

column7: GRRA: Gweru Residents and Ratepayers Association
column17: Gweru residents protest against the councils decision to hand them over to debt collectors over outstanding bills.
Property destruction: The Chiredzi offices of a prominent Zanu-PF official linked to former Vice President Joice Mujuru are petrol-bombed.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Hundreds of Zanu PF youths waiting for the arrival of President Robert Mugabe from his long holiday in the East, demonstrate against former party secretary for Administration Didymus Mutasa at the Harare International Airport.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Bikita South National Assembly Member Cde Jappy Jaboon was allegedly assaulted by his Chiredzi West counterpart Cde Darlington Chiwa after the Jaboon barred Chiwa from attending a meeting between the Zanu-PF Masvingo provincial leadership. Chiwa and war veterens allegedly assaulted Jaboon and tried to force their way into the meeting.

Masvingo Residents Trust stages a protest against Masvingo city councils decision to impose a roads levy and hire debt collectors to recover outstanding money from residents. The police block many protesters from joining the demonstration.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC Chivi Central district chairperson, Tyavanai Chibhebhe, is assaulted by a soldier for wearing an MDC t-shirt. The soldier is not arrested by police.
A man caught stealing is caned to death by community members and a village head after the thieves mother insists that he face a traditional punishment.
A man arrested for trespassing is severely tortured by police while in custody.
Police disperce hundreds of residents demonstrating against poor service delivery and alleged corruption by senior council officers. No injuries or instances of violence reported.

Farmers stage a peaceful demonstration at the ruling Zanu-PF headquarters demanding the intervention of President Robert Mugabe after they failed to get agricultural inputs under a project allegedly linked to two senior party officials

column6: Military Forces of Zimbabwe (1987-2017) Central Intelligence Organization
column17: A Congolese man is detained and tortured by the CIO. The man had complained of losing his livelihood in the DRC after SABOT, a company believed to be linked to President Robert Mugabe, had evicted him from his land.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu PF members sympathetic to Temba Mliswa the former Zanu PF provincial Chairperson held a demonstration in Chinhoyi. The demonstration was in response to Mliswa's arrest on allegations of being in possession of guns stolen from the white farmer whose farm he had taken over

column7: NAVUZ: National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe
column17: Hundreds of street traders, led by the National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe, protest against the practice by Harare authorities of allocating large portions of vending space to Zanu PF loyalists who are in turn renting them out to struggling vendors at huge rentals.

column7: ZARWU: Zimbabwe Amalgamated Railway Workers Union
column17: Workers belonging to ZARWU sit outside the offices of the National Railway of Zimbabwe, complaining that they are only receiving 20% of their salaries.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youths block and intimidate investors from the United Arab Emirates in Harare. The youths then protest against the presence of MDC-T councillors at the meeting. No reported injuries or damage.
Villagers are assaulted by the police. The villagers were praying to stop the acquisition of Cunningham's Maleme Ranch in Matobo by an official from the office of the president.
Residents demonstrate against a school following reports that staff are embezzling tuition money.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Zanu-PF youths assault two ward councillors during Tsvangirais visit to Harare.

column7: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: WOZA protest demanding the creation of jobs, a halt on the relocation of informal traders from Bulawayo city centre and the urgent convening of a country wide consultation to map a collective way forward on how to revamp the economy. The police violently break up the demonstration resulting in a number of protesters requiring medical attention.
A senior military figure assaults the director of the National Prosecuting Authority.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T activists violently clash with a War Veteren after being denied access to agricultural inputs.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T delegates chant and disrupt parliament to protest the poor attendance of Cabinet ministers to field queries during Question Time.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: a Bulawayo Zanu PF activist who has influence at Tshabalala police mobilized a group of neighbourhood watch committees to round up ten youth supporters of MDC-T under the guise that he wanted to get rid of thieves in the area. The youth were bundled into a pickup truck which had no registration plates and were detained without charge at Tshabalala police camp. It is alleged that the youths were assaulted and had difficulty in walking when they were released without charge three days later.
Protesters led by the National Youths Action Alliance march to the Zimbabwe Electoral Commission (ZEC) head offices demanding the immediate resignation of the organizations chairperson Rita Makarau

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu PF youths harassed and beat up an MDC-T activist at Kuwadzana Hall. Those who tried to stop the beating were threatened with death. The police did not take action against the perpetrators.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu-PF supporters march through the city of Mutare to """"thank"""" the politburo for firing the former secretary for administration Didymus Mutasa from the party.

Police set dogs on villagers panning for gold. After the villagers discovered the gold, the police barricaded the area and were seen loading gold into police vehicles. At least 10 villagers suffered severe injuries.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association
column17: School children are assaulted by war veterans and police after stealing sugar cane. The fields were reportedly owned by war veterens who gained the plots from Mugabes land reforms.

column6: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association
column9: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column17: A war veteran leader led a group of war veterans and Zanu PF youths to assault MDC Renewal members on a door to door campaign in the Entumbane B area, ward 10

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column8: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A Zanu PF supporter armed with a knife tries to attack Morgan Tsvangirai before being apprehended and beaten by MDC-T security.
Tobacco farmers protest over the low selling price of tobacco. The police are called in to restore order.

Bus operators in Bulawayo suspended operations protesting extortion and harassment by traffic police. Some operators destroy property and harass motorists. An anti-riot squad is dispatched to disperse the rioters.
Activist Itai Dzamara, responsible for organising anti-government protests in Harare, is abducted by unidentified individuals.
A man displaced by mining operations in Chiadzwa protests over the insufficient provision of alternative accommodation outside the Mutare district administors office.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column16: Movement for Democratic Change; Herald (Zimbabwe); New Zimbabwe
column17: MDC-T activists march outside parliament demanding answers over the disappearance of activist Itai Dzamara. There are conflicting reports over whether the demonstrators were violent or were attacked by police (the majority of Zimbabwe publications accuse the demonstrators of attacking the police while an MDC press release argues that the demonstrators were attacked).

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Police assault MDC-T party members at Harvest House after the MDC spearheads a protest over the abduction of activist Itai Dzamara .

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T Member of Parliament (MP) for Bulawayo East Thabitha Khumalo was assaulted by suspected youths in Mpopoma. The youths were allegedly hired by rival MDC-T politicians. Simultaneously MDC supporters are assaulted by another group of youths allegedly hired to disrupt an MDC-T meeting by Minister Obert Mpofu.
Prisoners in Chikurubi maximum security prison protest over the poor quality of their food. Police are called in to quell the riot. Five people die during the riots.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: ZANU-PF supporters beat and torture a person for wearing MDC-T regalia.

column6: Police Forces of Zimbabwe (1987-2017) Prison Guards
column17: Prisoners accused of masterminding the riot at Chikurubi prison have reportedly been severely tortured by warders since the riot.
Street traders demonstrate over being forced to pay daily fees to the council in order to trade. Riot police violently disperse street traders.
Students at the University of Zimbabwe clash with police while demonstrating over the stoppage of lessons and lack of services after lecturers and university workers went on strike.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: A MDC-T district organising secretary for Mount Darwin District is abducted by unknown assailants. The victim is exposed to unknown chemicals and loses consciousness during his abduction.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF members supporting on Omega Fani Hungwe are attacked by ZANU-PF members supporting George Chimhini's

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: The MDC-T welfare coordination officer for Marondera East Constituency is abducted by unidentified men.
The Combined Harare Residents Association demonstrate over the installation of prepaid water meters during a full council meeting.

column9: NAVUZ: National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe; MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: A man is severely beaten during an attempted abduction by an unknown group. The victim is a member of a human rights group in Zimbabwe, a chairperson of NAVUZ and had previously contested elections as an MDC-T candidate.

column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF supporters are beaten by state security agents after failing to show support for the candidature of Christopher Chingosho for Headlands MP.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Ushewokunze Housing Cooperative members, all of whom are Zanu-PF supporters, violently clashed over how to compensate CFI Holdings for the land on which the residents are settled.
Over 55 workers at Wattle Company and Vumba plant premises in Mutare fight running battles with police after storming their employers offices demanding outstanding salaries for the past year

GWERU City Council workers apply for permission to go on strike over non-payment of salaries and bonuses and lack of protective clothing, among other grievances. Employees engage in a protest march and denounce corrupt managers and councillors in front of the municipality offices.
MDC-T youths stage a protest in the Mpopoma-Pelandaba constituency claiming that the ruling party is preparing to rig the June 10 parliamentary by-elections.
University of Zimbabwe students protest over lecturer and staff strikes.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu PF supporters loyal to the losing candidate in the Highfield West primary elections Emmanuel Juta marched to the Harare Provincial offices on 7 April 2015 against winner Psychology Mazivisa.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T members protest against MDC-T vice president Thokozani Khupe during a party meeting. The demonstrators oppose Khupes push for the party to contest in the June 10 parliamentary by-elections

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu PF activists on besieged the ZCTUs regional offices in Bulawayo protesting against the unions planned anti-government demonstrations.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions
column8: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZCTU members demonstrate against job losses and government threats to freeze wages. In Bulawyo and Gwweru ZANU-PF activists try to block the protests. No reports of serious violence.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions
column17: ZCTU members demonstrate against job losses and government threats to freeze wages.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions
column8: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZCTU members demonstrate against job losses and government threats to freeze wages. In Bulawyo and Gwweru ZANU-PF activists try to block the protests. No reports of serious violence.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions
column17: ZCTU members demonstrate against job losses and government threats to freeze wages.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions
column17: ZCTU members demonstrate against job losses and government threats to freeze wages.
Over 50 jobless graduates take to the streets of Harare to demand that the government create jobs for them.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youths demonstrate against the release of MDC-T politcian Temba Mliswa. Temba Mliswa was arrested after disrupting a ZANU-PF rally.
Traditional leaders protest against the presence of Temba Mliswa, an MDC-T politician participating in upcoming local by-elections, in Hurungwe.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association
column17: War veterans lead a demonstration against Biggie Matiza the Minister of State in Mashonaland East.

Civil society activists protest outside the South African embassy in Harare against ongoing xenophobic attacks against Zimbabweans in South Africa. The police violently disperse the protesters and beat them with batons.

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: A MDC-T councillor is assaulted by members of his party. The councillor supports the bid of Wilfred Tanga as the 2018 candidate while his assailants support Milton Mhene.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Former Energy deputy minister Munacho Mutezo, linked to ex-vice president Mjuru, is assaulted by ZANU-PF and war veterans during independence day celebrations.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T politician, Thokozani Khupe, lanuches protests in Bulawayo against Morgan Tsvangirais decision to boycott the June by-elections.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: A MDC-T member is assaulted by ZAN-PF members after he criticises ZANU-PF as weakened by factionalism.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T MP for Budiriro, Costa Machingauta and 10 other supporters are assaulted by suspected Zanu (PF) supporters.

column6: Military Forces of Zimbabwe (1987-2017) Central Intelligence Organization
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T Chairperson Pepukai Mudzembiri is beaten to death by suspected CIO agents.

Anti-riot police are dispatched to the National Railways of Zimbabwe (NRZ) main station in Bulawayo as the struggling parastatals workers besieged company offices there to press management over unpaid salaries. There are no reports of injuries or destruction of property.
Police detain and beat a suspected thief to death.

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Property destruction: MDC-T members petrol bomb the house of Zanu-PF Harare Provincial Youth League chairperson Cde Godwin Gomwe. There are no reported injuries.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Two village headmen are abducted by suspected ZANU-PF activists and tortured. The abductees are accused of misleading the electorate and campaigning for independent candidate Temba Mliswa. Six other residents are assaulted by ZANU-PF activists on the same day.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu PF youths disrupt a service at St Marys Anglican Church in Chitungwiza and protest demanding an audience with the churches leadershhip over a piece of land they want to grab and subdivide into residential stands for party members. The protesters are dispersed by police.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Three members of MDC-T party were severely assaulted by ZANU-PF members at Thorncroft Primary School in Goromonzi South (Ruwa) and forced to attend a belated Independence Day celebration on 26 April 2015.
Unidentified assailants beat civilians and deface the electoral posters of independent electoral candidate Temba Mliswa.
Unidentified attackers beat locals for information concerning the whereabouts of opposition political figures.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T supporters protest outside the ongoing Southern African Development Community (Sadc) summit in Harare, demanding President Robert Mugabes resignation. The police disperse the protest. There are no reports of serious injuries.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youth assault staff at the farm of Temba Mliswa, an ex-ZANU-PF politician running as an independent in an upcoming by-election.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A National Constitutional Assembly party (NCA) activist is physically assaulted by Zanu PF youths at Beit Hall in Dangamvura while attending his party programme.
Two groups of villagers riot and clash over whether a suspect in a ritual murder case should is extra-judicially executed.
A group of about 60 people march to Guruve hospital, police and CIO offices to demonstrate against corruption at these institutions.

column6: Military Forces of Zimbabwe (1987-2017) Central Intelligence Organization
column17: CIO agents visit and beat people they suspect of organising a protest earlier in the day.
City of Harare employees protest over non payment of outstanding salaries.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Journalists covering the protest in Chitungwiza are assaulted by police, leading to one journliast being hospitalised.

Residents of Bulawayo and civil society organisations stage a demonstration and demand an apology from President Robert Mugabe over his statements that the Kalanga people are uneducated and responsible for petty crimes in South Africa.

column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Residents of Chitungwiza protest against the decision by the mayor to bar them from council meetings. The protesters clash with the police and ZANU-PF cadres resulting in damage to property.
City of Harare employees protest over non payment of outstanding salaries and call for the resignation of the Town Clerk, Tendai Mahachi.

column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Police violently evict Zanu-PF youths who had invaded an 82 hectares Anglican Church plot in Chitungwiza. The police reportedly beat and assault the youths during the operation.
Police violently disperse striking Green fuel workers who have not been paid their salaries for the last 3 month resulting in serious injuries.

column9: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: Women of Zimbabwe Arise protest against President Robert Mugabes recent claim that Kalanga people were """"uneducated criminals"""". Police arrest the leader of WOZA and other demonstrators.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-N: Movement for Democratic Change (Ncube Faction)
column17: Zanu PF activists seriously beat up a MDC-N activist accusing him of having benefitted from a government fertilizer distribution scheme.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: MDC-T members protest against youth unemployment and economic mismanagement. The demonstrators are prevented from handing over a petition by armed police.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF holds a rally in support of their candidate, Keith Guzah, for the upcoming by-election. Shopkeepers and residents that refuse to attend the rally are assaulted by ZANU-PF youth.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Four people are assaulted at Sengwe Township by ZANU-PF youth for failing to attend the meeting addressed by Vice President Mphoko.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Two groups of MDC-T youth, one aligned to Morgan Tsvangira and the other aligned to the parties deputy president Ms Thokozani Khupe, clash. Tsvangirai and Khupe camps are sharply divided over the parties decision to boycott the June 10 parliamentary by-elections.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Two groups of MDC-T youth, one aligned to provincial chairperson Ms Dorcas Sibanda and the other aligned to the parties deputy president Ms Thokozani Khupe, clash during a speech by Morgan Tsvangirai.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Scores of Zanu-PF members in Harare East constituency aligned to Cde Mavis Gumbo hold demonstrations against the parties decision to declare Cde Terence Mukupe as the party candidate ahead of the June 10 by-elections

column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A ZANU-PF man is abducted by members of the Zimbabwean military. The victim is believed to be allied to Joice Mjuru.
On 21 May 2015, a group of local vigilantes battled with highway robbers in Mashiloni (Beitbridge West, Matabeleland South), managing to disarm and hospitalise one of the criminals. [size=no report]

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A man is hacked to death by ZANU-PF supporters. The militia had allegedly been tracking the victim since the 2008 electoral violence. The political affiliations of the victim are not specified.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Six ZANU-PF members allegedly stormed a Seventh Day Adventist Church destroying a 95-metre long precast wall.

column6: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column9: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column17: Three bodyguards employed by MDC-Renewal treasurer assault a provincial youth leader who had a personal dispute with the MDC-renewal treasurer.

column7: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column9: MDC-Renewal: Movement for Democratic Change (Biti Faction)
column17: Supporters of MDC Renewal Team treasurer-general Elton Mangoma and provincial youth leader Believe Tevera violently clash.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Civilians accused of supporting the former Mashonaland West ruling party provincial chairperson Temba Mliswa, who is running as an independent candidate in the upcoming by-elections, are severely beaten by ZANU-PF activists.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A Zanu PF member was assaulted by other Zanu PF members after he had been suspended from the provincial structures.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu-PF youths beat up rivals and disrupting a meeting organised by Temba Mliswa, an ex-Zanu-PF politician running as an independent in the upcoming by-election.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front; Journalists (Zimbabwe)
column17: ZANU-PF activists demonstrate outside the trial of Zanu PF Harare provincial youth leader Godwin Gomwe. Gomwe was arrested for abusing Grace Mugabe's name to extort $25 000 form 10 housing cooperatives. The rioters smash cameras of journalists trying to photograph Gomwe and overpower police to enter the trial.
Employees of hospitality and retail group, Meikles Limited, who were retrenched in March, stage a demonstration in Bulawayo demanding their outstanding severance packages.
Vendors clash and exchange blows during a meeting organised to discuss how to react to the governments order for informal traders to vacate Harare CBD.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: On 6 June elections were held for Hwedza Zanu PF District committee and officials in charge of the elections were to come from Masvingo. Before their arrival chaos broke out as Zanu PF youths sang revolutionary songs denouncing one of the candidates identified as Chigodora. They labelled him aoegamatoxa- (a derogatory term for a faction belonging to former Vice President Mujuru).

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu PF members interrupt a meeting by acting provincial Chair Samuel Undenge to demonstrate against the demoted MP Enock Porusingazi. Undenge ordered the ZANU-PF youth to assault the demonstrators leading to severe injuries.

column7: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: War veterans gatecrash a ZANUF-PF interdistrict meeting and heckle politburo member Oppah Muchinguri and accuse her of being aligned to former Vice-President Joice Mujurus Gamatox camp. In response Muchinguris supporters clash and fight with the war veterans.

Vendors protest against the presence of ZANU-PF officials during a council-ordered relocation from a shopping centre to the flea market. The vendors said that they are from different parties and queried that other parties are not represented.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF members assult three civilians distributing posters supporting Tsemba Mliswa, an independent candidate in the by-elections as ex ZANU-PF provincial chairman.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Polling agents who were tracked and assaulted at their homes soon after the elections on 10 June 2015
Property destruction: Soldiers destroy the homes of 22 villagers and raze crops in a campaign to appropriate the villagers land.
Two factions of the Apostolic Faith Mission clash over use of church premises leaving some of the members injured.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youths invade car park business in Dzivarasekwa and announce the area a ""Zanu-PF youth league development area"" in celebration of ZANU-PFs victory in the June by-elections.
Villagers from Raffingora find and mine gold deposits from a nearby hill. The police later enter the area to severely beat and torture the miners and chase them out of the area.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Five MDC-T youths from Dzivaresekwa constituency in Harare sustained injuries in politically motivated violence that was perpetrated by ZANU-PF youths
Two senior ZANU-PF members hire soldiers to assault and chase artisanal miners out of a mining site in Bindura.
Residents of Ruwa protest against poor service delivery and alleged abuse of funds by top council officials.

column16: New Zimbabwe; Zimbabwe Mail; Southern Eye
column17: Workers at the Gweru based Bata shoe company engage in tea-break protests against the reduction of their salaries as well as the non-payment of their housing and transport allowances.

Violence was reported at Solomio farm estate in Ruwa ward 7 Goromonzi South between members of rival housing cooperatives. The two, Shingiriro cooperative said to be led by MP Petronella Kagonye and Solomon Mujuru Housing cooperative owned by Oswell Gwanzura, are said to be claiming land at Solomio estates. On 18 June 2015 members of the two groups took various weapons to the estate and started fighting.
Over forty police descend on the Mudambumi Complex in Bulawayo and severely assault the patrons leading to severe injuries. The reason for the assault is unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Zimbabwe (1987-2017) Central Intelligence Organization
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: A man is killed by suspected CIO agents after receiving threatening calls. The victim was politically affiliated with MDC-T.
The director of the Oxford International College was allegedly severely beaten by 6 police officers of the Chitungwiza police station.
Hundreds of street vendors protested in Harare against plans to drive them off pavements in the city to designated trading sites.
Vendors march to parliament and hand in a petition demanding to be allowed to continue selling their wares in the central business district.

column7: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; Street Traders (Zimbabwe); Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: Vendors and Women of Zimbabwe Arise demonstrate against the ban on vending in Bulawayo.
Vendors riot against government plans to relocate them out of the CBD and to designated trading sites. The rioters chase the Harare town clerk and destroy municipal property.
Artisanal miners demonstrate and sing liberation songs to protest against their eviction from mining sites. The police manage to evict the miners. There are no reported injuries.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front; Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: A female ZANU-PF supporter is assaulted by six other ZANU-PF supporters. The victim was accused of supporting ousted Vice President Joice Mjuru.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Two MDC- T supporters were severely assaulted by Zanu PF youths accompanying the Goromonzi South Legislator Kagonye at Goromonzi turnoff in ward 25. The incident took place during a ceremony to donate equipment to various schools by the MP.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Youths aligned with Minister of State for Provincial Affairs for Mashonaland East Joel Biggie Matiza protest and chase Deputy Minister for Agriculture Paddington Zhanda in Marondera. Both Matiza and Zhanda are competing in the election for Mashonaland East Provincial Chairperson.
Members of the Harare South Housing Union, the Apex Board and Hilarious Housing Cooperative violently clash over the allocation of houses and evictions.

Two individuals visit Telrose mine in Kadoma and demand $30 000 a week from the mine on behalf of Russell Goreraza, Grace Mugabes son. The two individuals are assaulted by mine workers and chased from the premesis. Police return to Telrose mine and assault workers suspected of assaulting and chasing emissaries of Russell Goreraza, Grace Mugabes son.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column8: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youths aligned to Solomon Mujuru Housing Cooperative, led by Cde Oswell Gwanzura, and Cde Petronella Kagonye engage in a gun battle. Kagonyes bodyguards are also involved in the battle. There are no reported casualties.
Workers at Bata Shoe company down tools to pressure the shoe manufacturer to review their housing and transport allowances.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youth invade and vandalise the farm of former Politburo Member and Minister of Masvingo Provincial Affairs Kudakwashe Bhasikiti. Farm workers are assaulted and seriously injured during the invasion.
Police beat a freelance journalist after he photographs police beating a suspected thief.

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: An MDC-T activist is assaulted and his property damaged by fellow party members who accuse the victim of aligning himself to the Renewal Team.
Vendors protest and stand their ground against riot police who have been commissioned to remove their stalls.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Two factions of ZANU-PF fight running battles during a district election. Each side accuses the other of poll rigging and the use of Gamatox tactics.
Informal traders throw stones at police during an operation to remove street vendors from the CBD.
Police detain and beat vendors during a drive to remove informal traders from Harare CBD.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Opposition politicians and religious leaders lead a vigil for abducted activist Itai Dzamara in Harare. Police allegedly assault and beat some of the demonstrators.

column6: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A Zanu PF youth is assaulted by MDC-T youths after shouting that Tsvangirai would never rule Zimbabwe.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction); Women (Zimbabwe); Teachers (Zimbabwe)

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

Multiple vendors including leaders of National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe, Sten Zvorwadza and Samuel Wadzai were beaten up and arrested by police after demonstrating against confiscation of their wares.
A farm-owning couple are assaulted and robbed by men in police and military uniform.

column7: UFAWU: United Food and Allied Workers Union
column17: Workers and representatives of the United Food and Allied Workers Union protest against a ruling by the Supreme Court to legalise termination with three months notice and without benefits.
Hundreds of women staged a peaceful march in Harare demanding an end to early child marriages before handing over a petition to Minister of Womens Affairs.

Alleged sex workers demonstrated at the Zaka offices of CARE International to demand inclusion in the organizations ENSURE program which offers porridge and cooking oil to pregnant women and children.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

At least 14 stree traders, including 3 university students, were arrested for throwing stones at police who were engaging in a clean-up exercise in the """"Guta ngarichene"""" neighbourhood.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions; Journalists (Zimbabwe)
column17: Scores of people gathered near the ZCTU offices to prepare for a march before police arrived and broke up the gathering, arresting the organizers and journalists who had been there to cover it.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: An MDC-T member is assaulted by a ZANU-PF activist for failing to attend the Heros Day celebrations commemorating Zimbabwes independence.

Street traders and police ""engaged in running battles"" as the police attempted to seize their products following a council order last week which said that all vendors had to relocate to designated areas.
Police conduct early morning raids on street vendors. The police allegedly severely beat the vendors before looting their goods.
Defusal: A live grenade was left near an ATM along Leopold Takawira St. in Harare but was disposed of by police before it could cause damage. The motive for leaving the grenade was not clear.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: About 300 opposition MDC-T youths demonstrated in Harare on 20/08 over the termination of workers in several industries.

column7: ZCTU: Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions
column17: The Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions demonstrates against the mass dismissal of workers. Over 25 000 people have lost their jobs after a recent Supreme Court ruling that employers can fire workers on three months notice. The police monitor the demonstration without directly interacting with it.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF supporters vandalise the houses and business of members of the newly-formed Elton Mangoma-led Renewal Democrats of Zimbabwe. No injuries reported.

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

Protesters in Masvingo march to submit a petition to Masvingo Town Clerk. The procession is interrupted by police who arrest the protest leaders at the scene of the demonstration.

column7: ZIBAWU: Zimbabwe Banks and Allied Workers Union
column17: BankABC employees affiliated with Zimbabwe Banks and Allied Workers Union protest against their dismissal by the company. The workers were fired following the Supreme Court ruling on July 17 allowing employers to terminate employees contracts on three months notice.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF members assault council workers who have been assigned to formally register market stall places. The youths are believed to be associated with ZANU-PF land barons who make money from leasing the stalls.
Approximately 1000 Bulawayo residents take to the streets to protest against the city councils plans to install pre-paid water meters at their households.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Rival factions of the MDC-T physically exchange blows during selection of members of the electoral college ahead of internal elections to fill four vacant posts.

column7: WOZA: Women of Zimbabwe Arise; Women (Zimbabwe)
column17: 900 members of WOZA protest outside the ministry of local governance and demand an end to the victimisation of street traders and the looting of their goods by policemen.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Residents of Gwanda protest against the installation of prepaid water metres.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youth disrupt a meeting held by ZANU-PF personnel on the city council budget. The demonstrators accuse the councillor of having lied about giving people jobs at the city council.

Over 300 recently retrenched workers protest outside Zimascos main smelting plant. The demonstrators barricaded the entrances and exits and demanded that management pay them their outstanding salaries.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: A ZANU-PF man who slapped another member and accused him of supporting Mjuru is severely beaten by ZANU-PF youths.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Members of the NYS assault ZANU-PF supporters baring pictures of Joshua Nkomo and Grace Mugabe. The attackers are believed to be affiliated with Graces rival, Vice-President Mnangagwa who recently insulted Nkomos legacy.
Workers at the recently closed Queens Mine stage a sit in and demand the payment of their outstanding salaries.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF factions clash over the use of the First Aid venue. A faction allegedly led by Edmore Paradzano provoked a group supposedly linked to Nickson Maguvaza by indicating that they should not meet at the venue as they were not a true Zanu PF group. The two groups all refer to themselves as the true Zanu PF groups. The two groups fought and some people were injured.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: ZANU-PF youths attack MDC-T members organising a rally at which Tsvangirai will speak. The attackers are beaten back by the MDC-T members.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: ZANU-PF youths aligned with Grace Mugabe and Vice President Mnangagwa clash and engage in running battles ahead of Graces visit to Bulawayo.
Two men allegedly assaulted Alec Nhindion on grounds of political differences.

Students from a nearby school protest outside the United Church of Christ Zimbabwe after the reverend of the church seized a vehicle belonging to their headmaster. The police arrest the students at the scene of the protest.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: In Gweru, intra-party conflict in the MDC-T occurred when two factions were making travel arrangements to the burial of Thamsanga Mahlangu

After the distruption of foods and good, a stampede developed. The stampede led the military police to beat up people and set dogs on them. A number of people were injured because of the stampede and beating by the police.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Zanu-PF district chairperson allegedly sent some youths to beat up a local headman for refusing to attend a Zanu-PF meeting to organise the party.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

column17: At the burial of Thamsanqa Mahlangu (late Nkulumane legislator), MDC-T youths allegedly clashed along factional lines after the party got itself involved in a feud.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Three MDC-T members were beaten up by two Zanu-PF members at Gazebo in Goromonzi.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: There was heavy fighting amongst Zanu-PF supporters in Mvurwi, Mazowe North.

column17: One war veteran was allegedly assaulted by Tawanda Murefu at Nyahondo Township in Mutoko South. The perpetrator accused the victim of being pro- former Vice President.

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column9: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction); Journalists (Zimbabwe)
column17: After about 200 MDC-T supporters gathered near a court house, Police dispersed the crowds , assaulting MDC-T members and Journalists.

column17: Rival ZANU-PF members openly fight during a restructuring exercise in Kadoma resulting in several party members injured. The violence allegedly broke out when members of Generation 40, or G40 faction, accused their rivals of rigging the elections.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: Transform Zimbabwe had a meeting in Glen View South. They did not finish the meeting as they were disturbed by some Zanu-PF youths who came in three truckloads and assaulted people gathered at the meeting

column7: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
column17: Hundreds of MDC-T youths in Harare yesterday defied heavy police presence in the city centre and held a peaceful demonstration.

Harare East residents have demonstrated against poor service delivery by the Harare City Council.

column7: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column9: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front

A Masvingo bank branch has reportedly been burnt by angry depositors as the branch ran out of cash with scores of people in the queue.
Clashes between Masvingo municipal police and local vendors nearly turned fatal after a council official was hacked with a machete by a trader protesting the confiscation of his wares.
Lupane State University (LSU) students reportedly held a mini-protest demanding their meal allowances following their participation at the college and university sports games in Bulawayo.

Police arrived at the scene and attacked the demonstrators with baton sticks before violently bundling some of them into Police trucks.

Youth supporters of the opposition Zimbabwe People First (ZimPF) brawled over t-shirts at the parties Harare provincial rally. Clashes broke out when t-shirts branded with ZimPF leader Joice Mujurus face were being distributed around mid-day.

column6: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
column17: On 25 June, members of ZimPF were reportedly assaulted by suspected Zanu PF supporters accusing them of attending the ZimPF rally

Police in Zimbabwe detained five journalists covering another protest against Vice President Phelekezela Mphokos one-and-a-half-year stay in a luxury hotel in Harare. There are also claims that up to three activists were also picked up at the demonstration.

Members of various church organizations, under the banner of the Prayer Network of Zimbabwe, staged a peaceful demonstration in Harare demanding the resignation of Primary and Secondary Education Minister Lazarus Dokora over the government's introduction of the national pledge in schools.

Police arrested at least 30 Bulawayo youth members of the Bulawayo Youth Arise (BUYA) group who were protesting against grinding poverty and joblessness they blamed on President Robert Mugabe's government.
Zimbabwes army was deployed in the restive border town of Beitbridge where protesters angry about a new ban on imports set on fire a warehouse belonging to the state revenue authority.
In Rusape, angry residents barricaded roads with huge stones and logs protesting over dusty red soils being used by the local authority to refill retarded earth roads.

In mass protest action in Ruwa, taxi operators were blocking roads using bricks, logs and granite rocks while others were burning tyres. Police had to use teargas and water cannons to disperse the violent hooligans who were toyi-toying along the roads harassing commuters.

In mass protest action in Mabvuku-Tafara, taxi operators were blocking roads using bricks, logs and granite rocks while others were burning tyres. Police had to use teargas and water cannons to disperse the violent hooligans who were toyi-toying along the roads harassing commuters.

In mass protest action in Zimre Park, taxi operators were blocking roads using bricks, logs and granite rocks while others were burning tyres. Police had to use teargas and water cannons to disperse the violent hooligans who were toyi-toying along the roads harassing commuters.

Protesting taxi operators clashed with police in Epworth outside Harare. The police had to fire tears gas and water cannons after some officers were assaulted while protesters used missiles and blocked the roads.
In Hatfield, taxi drivers and conductors blocked roads with stones and attacked any vehicles found ferrying people into town.
Bulawayo public transport operators parked their vehicles in protest against police brutality on the streets of the city.

Police arrested at least 100 residents and minibus taxi drivers in Mabvuku suburb. Some of the protesters were injured when riot police set dogs on them and it is reported that rioters allegedly stoned the police and damaged their vehicle.
In ongoing political unrest, skirmishes between police and rioters took place in Budiriro. 19 people were arrested

In ongoing political unrest, skirmishes between police and rioters took place in Mufakose. 13 people were arrested as protesters were blockading roads and burning tyres before the police intervened to restore order.
In ongoing political unrest, skirmishes between police and rioters took place in Warren Park.
In Manicaland, a bus belonging to Inter-Africa Bus Company was attacked with stones by unknown assailants, but there were no injuries and the driver did not stop.
Seven Plumtree taxi operators were arrested for trying to stage a demonstration against police roadblocks.
Police arrested 36 people for staging illegal demonstrations in various parts of the country, including 14 white Zimbabweans and a Belgian national who were protesting in Victoria Falls.

More than 40 children in Zimbabwe have been admitted to hospital after inhaling teargas that police used inside their block of flats in Bulawayo. The incident took place when police responded to sporadic attacks by a group of young people during demonstrations against President Robert Mugabe two weeks ago.
Protesters in Bulawayo blocked roads with burning tyres, torched vehicles, looted shops and fought running battles with anti-riot police.
