Ten days after official reopening of University of Juba the claimed 560 dismissed students in a surprise rally yesterday threatened to stage a protest if the concerned officials in the government particularly the Ministry of Higher Education and others concerned with education affairs failed to intervened in the University administration and students row.

At least three people were killed and several wounded on 12 and 17 August when the Sudanese army (SAF) twice attacked Renk county of Upper Nile state, according to a government official. The state governor, Simon Kun Puoc, on Saturday told Sudan Tribune that SAF troops invaded Renk agricultural scheme in the Adham area of Samadi payam [district], killing and wounding innocent civilians on their farms, before a South Sudanese army (SPLA) company in the area intervened.

Government soldiers committed murder, torture and rape in the largest and troubled South Sudanese state of Jonglei. Between 15 July and 20 August, the [UNAMID] mission said that the SPLA soldiers allegedly killed one person. It further said there are ""27 allegations of torture or ill-treatment, such as beatings, and simulated drowning in some cases, 12 rapes, six attempted rapes and eight abductions.""

A human rights and civil society organisation in South Sudans capital Juba were raided and looted by unknown gunmen, activists said on Wednesday. Biel Boutros Biel, the executive director of the South Susan Human Rights Society For Advocacy (SSHURSA), saif the office was broken early on Wednesday.
On Wednesday other forces beaten up a Wildlife Police brigadier, also after reductions in their pay was announced.

International hip hop star and renowned peace activist Emmanuel Jal was badly beaten by police in the South Sudanese capital of Juba last night on 8 September 2012.

column6: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Movement of forces: 266 Nepalese peacekeepers arrived in Juba. They will be deployed at the UNDP IDP protection sites.
Relatives of a man shot by the SPLA killed a soldier and a policeman in retaliation.
Recruitment: Around early February, the SPLA carried out a major recruitment drives in Warrap, West and North Bahr al Ghazal and West Equatoria.
Change to armed group: 700 SPLA soldiers defected in Lakes to join Machars forces.
Soldiers arrested 24 Nuer men outside Tomping UN base in early February. They were interrogated and accused of being rebels while being beaten with sticks.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting in Kerich village, Rumbek east between SPLA pro Machar and pro Kiir.
SPLA soldiers attempted to disarm a civilian with a gun, but he fired on them, and they shot him.
Government and JEM soldiers attacked Beer village (~28km NE of Leer town) and opened fire in early February. No injuries reported.
During an unannounced disarmament exercise, SPLA and herdsmen fought in Pulkuc, a town 14 km from Rumbek. 3 soldiers and 2 cattle herders died.
Civilians killed in Kolnyang payam, 30km north-east of the capital, Bor by a Murle Ethnic militia. 28 people died. Newstex reported 34 dead. 12 were also reported abducted.

HRW released a report that confirmed between the dates of 29 Jan - 14 Feb, both parties to the conflict carried out lootings and ""targeted civilians and carried out extrajudicial execution based on ethnicity.""

column17: Fighting reported in Thorgwang (also spelled Thur-Gwang) in Manyo County, Upper Nile State. Fashoda County and Renk County are adjacent to Manyo County. Sudan Tribune reported the destruction of many Shillock homes. 17 deaths reported.

The Sudanese airforce allegedly bombed part of Maban county twice on Friday, in what was believed to be an attempt to attack the SPLA-N. In the first attack six people were killed (two men, three woman, and a child), some of whom were believed to be refugees/IDPs, while four others were wounded.
The Sudanese airforce allegedly bombed part o Maban county twice on Friday, in what was believed to be an attempt to attack the SPLA-N. In the second attack, a large number of cattle were killed.

Unidentified armed group attacked Yusuf Batil / Yosif Batil refugee camp. Civilians were killed and cattle stolen. Tensions between refugees and the host community are reported to be increasing. Later reports said that 21 people were killed in attacks on Youssef Batail camp in Feb and March 2014.
Non-violent activity: Reports of youth in Nasir sporadically shooting.

Reports that civilians were targeted and killed during the army barracks fighting. ""Three civilians were shot dead by soldiers at Nyakuron"", a neighborhood In Juba. It is claimed that Nuer civilians were being sought after but many of the civilians killed were East African (from Ethiopia and Uganda). 12 civilians killed total.

column16: IHS Global Insight; Defence Web; VOA
column17: Fighting erupted at the army barracks over payment. Sudan Tribune reported that the fighting was over preferential treatment of the Ugandan army. I H S reported that one side of the shooting was part of a Nuer army faction from Jonglei. Sporadic shooting broke out in several parts of Juba. 24 soldiers died.
Non-violent activity: While guards took cover during fighting in the Giyada SPLA army base, 120 military personnel suspected of crimes and human rights violations escaped custody.

Shooting still heard morning of 6/3/2014, a day after in-fighting at the army barracks.

column6: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Weapons Seizure: South Sudanese officials intercepted 11 UN trucks carrying weapons to Ghanian peacekeepers in Unity State.
Nuer cattle keeper in Dhiak, Unity State, was attacked by armed men. The men were suspected to be Dinka cattle rustlers from Lakes state. 260 cattle were stolen. 10 people died.
A drunk South Sudanese soldier shot three SPLA/M soldiers of another ethnicity. He ran away and hid, but was found and killed by SPLA/M soldiers. 4 Ugandan labourers were killed in the crossfire.

column17: SPLM Youth League held a rally requesting UNMISS to stay out of South Sudan internal affairs and for the UN to stop supporting opposition forces.

A group of youth believed to be from the Murle tribe engaged in a cattle raid from a camp in Nawai area. 2 herders were killed and 2 wounded. About 100 cows were stolen.
Reports that the government is targeting and killing Nuer leaders in the Leer community.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

Protesters demonstrated for three reasons: 1. Denouncing Hilde Johnson of the UN after weapons were found in Lakes, 2. in support of Kiir, and 3. against opposition requests for early elections and a transitional government.
9 people were killed and four suffered gunshot wounds over a dispute which brought out about a girl at Yhaga cattle camp between the Gaak and Manuer clans.

An SPLA brigadier general was killed after a dispute with some police, one of whom was allegedly drunk.
